instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-02016-A  water damage smoked M1  I miss the A1466 days!"
threads.message:
Seems the new M1 Air's are no different than their previous models.   The backlight power is right next to LPDT_INT data lines that run straight to the M1.
I total so many new MacBook logic boards for water damage or surges that find their way to the T2 or the processor it is depressing.

Am I  a bad tech?  Am I the only one that is getting discouraged with these failures?
I bet I have to let 20-40% go to the bone pile.   I miss the A1466 days!   I never totaled those!

threads.title: 820-02016-A  water damage smoked M1  I miss the A1466 days!"
threads.message:
Apple found a "good" way to burn the machines voiding warranty fix.
Almost any liquid spill ends with dead board...
